title: Education Program Outcome Type Vocabulary
description: Controlled vocabulary for outcomes of participation in education programs or pathways.

terms.label: Degree Awarded
terms.definition: The person successfully completed the program and was awarded a degree (e.g., associate, bachelor, master, doctoral).

terms.label: Certificate Awarded
terms.definition: The person successfully completed the program and was awarded a certificate, diploma, or similar non-degree credential.

terms.label: Program Completed, No Credential Awarded
terms.definition: The person completed the program requirements in the source system, but no credential was formally awarded (for example, noncredit programs).

terms.label: Program Withdrawal
terms.definition: The person withdrew from the program before completion, whether voluntarily or administratively.

terms.label: Program Transfer
terms.definition: The person left the program to transfer into a different program or institution, as recorded in the source system.

terms.label: Program Ongoing
terms.definition: The person remains actively enrolled in the program and has not yet reached a terminal outcome at the time of reporting.

terms.label: Other Program Outcome
terms.definition: A program outcome that does not fit another, more specific category in this vocabulary but is needed to represent a source system.
